name: Curry Ramen from Netflix Midnight Diner: Tokyo Stories
description: Inspired by a Netflix TV drama series "Midnight Diner: Tokyo Stories" (season 2), I followed the Master's way to make his Curry Ramen.
recipeIngredient: 1 package instant ramen noodles ((I recommend Sapporo Ichiban brand Shio Ramen—salt flavored))
the leftover Japanese curry of your choice

recipeInstructions.text: Reheat 1 serving of the leftover Japanese curry of your choice. Add ¼–½ cup water to loosen up the curry.
recipeInstructions.name: Reheat 1 serving of the leftover Japanese curry of your choice. Add ¼–½ cup water to loosen up the curry.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook 1 package instant ramen noodles according to the package instructions. I usually add the seasoning before touching the noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook 1 package instant ramen noodles according to the package instructions. I usually add the seasoning before touching the noodles.

recipeInstructions.text: When the dried noodles look moisten, gently loosen up the noodles with chopsticks. Once the timer is up, serve the ramen noodles in a ramen bowl (or a large bowl).
recipeInstructions.name: When the dried noodles look moisten, gently loosen up the noodles with chopsticks. Once the timer is up, serve the ramen noodles in a ramen bowl (or a large bowl).

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the hot curry over the noodles. In the "Midnight Diner: Tokyo Stories" drama, the curry was served over one-third of the noodles. Enjoy immediately!

review.reviewBody: Oh my gosh this was perfect! Came home from camping and had some curry sauce left that I took for stuffing crescent roll dough and cooking in a pie iron (campfire curry pan!!). I modified that curry sauce recipe from your doria recipe and typically use the sauce on top of fries :) Really wanted soup, found this recipe, happened to have 3 packs of Sapporo miso ramen on hand. It hit the spot!

Wow, this is so rich and delicious. Definitely a comfort food, and one I will not eat often because it is so rich (and, well... not that healthy of course, haha), but this to me is a really nice treat to have once in blue moon to change things up. I am happy to see your recipe used Sapporo Ichiban Shio Ramen. I didn't fully read the recipe before choosing one for this recipe, and that is the one I chose! :D

What a sweet idea to make it on the night you watch the episode... Wow! I haven't watched Season 2 yet. I only saw season 1. I will have to check it out soon. :)

Thanks for this recipe, Nami! I love how versatile Japanese curry is. There's so many ways to make it and serve it! I used rehydrated shiitakes and shiitake dashi for 1/3 of the broth when I made the curry and it was really good! Tasted great with this ramen!
